001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * <h2>Installation</h2>
006 *
007 * <h3>Modules</h3>
008 *
009 * <p>For each of our APIs there is a separate module with all type and request classes.</p>
010 *
011 * <dl>
012 *     <dt>commercetools-sdk-java-api</dt>
013 *     <dd>models and request builders for the product API</dd>
014 *     <dt>commercetools-sdk-java-importapi</dt>
015 *     <dd>models and request builders for the import API</dd>
016 *     <dt>commercetools-sdk-java-ml</dt>
017 *     <dd>models and request builders for the machine learning API</dd>
018 *     <dt>commercetools-sdk-java-history</dt>
019 *     <dd>models and request builders for the audit API</dd>
020 * </dl>
021 *
022 * <p>The SDK provides three HTTP client modules and one default module which serves as alias.</p>
023 * <dl>
024 *     <dt>commercetools-okhttp-client4</dt>
025 *     <dd>uses OkHttp client 4.0</dd>
026 *     <dt>commercetools-okhttp-client3</dt>
027 *     <dd>uses OkHttp client 3.0</dd>
028 *     <dt>commercetools-apachehttp-client</dt>
029 *     <dd>uses Apache HTTP async client 5.1</dd>
030 *     <dt>commercetools-http-client</dt>
031 *     <dd>alias for commercetools-okhttp-client4</dd>
032 * </dl>
033 *
034 * <p>The module <code>rmf-java-base</code> provides the base classes and common abstractions like {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiHttpClient},
035 * {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.Middleware} etc.</p>
036 *
037 * All modules are published to Maven Central.
038 *
039 * <h3>Gradle</h3>
040 *
041 * <pre>{@code
042 * ext {
043 *     versions = [
044 *         commercetools: "<latest version>"
045 *     ]
046 * }
047 *
048 * repositories {
049 *     mavenCentral()
050 * }
051 *
052 * dependencies {
053 *     implementation "com.commercetools.sdk:commercetools-http-client:${versions.commercetools}"
054 *     implementation "com.commercetools.sdk:commercetools-sdk-java-api:${versions.commercetools}"
055 *     implementation "com.commercetools.sdk:commercetools-sdk-java-importapi:${versions.commercetools}"
056 *     implementation "com.commercetools.sdk:commercetools-sdk-java-ml:${versions.commercetools}"
057 * }
058 * }</pre>
059 *
060 * <h3>Maven</h3>
061 *
062 * <pre>{@code
063 * <properties>
064 *     <commercetools.version><!-- latest version --></commercetools.version>
065 * </properties>
066 * <dependencies>
067 *     <dependency>
068 *       <groupId>com.commercetools.sdk</groupId>
069 *       <artifactId>commercetools-http-client</artifactId>
070 *       <version>${commercetools.version}</version>
071 *     </dependency>
072 *     <dependency>
073 *       <groupId>com.commercetools.sdk</groupId>
074 *       <artifactId>commercetools-sdk-java-api</artifactId>
075 *       <version>${commercetools.version}</version>
076 *     </dependency>
077 *     <dependency>
078 *       <groupId>com.commercetools.sdk</groupId>
079 *       <artifactId>commercetools-sdk-java-importapi</artifactId>
080 *       <version>${commercetools.version}</version>
081 *     </dependency>
082 *     <dependency>
083 *       <groupId>com.commercetools.sdk</groupId>
084 *       <artifactId>commercetools-sdk-java-ml</artifactId>
085 *       <version>${commercetools.version}</version>
086 *     </dependency>
087 * </dependencies>
088 * }</pre>
089 *
090 * <h3>Troubleshooting</h3>
091 *
092 * <h4>Spring Framework</h4>
093 *
094 * <p>The Spring Framework has an optional dependency to OkHttp in version 3.x. To avoid problems use the <code>commercetools-okhttp-client3</code>
095 * or <code>commercetools-apachehttp-client</code> module instead of the module <code>commercetools-http-client</code></p>
096 */
097public class Installation {
098}
